comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Ourmiah = Urmia From encyclopedia.farlex.com/Ourmiah "Capital of West Azerbaijan province, northwestern Iran, 130 km/81 mi southwest of Tabriz; population (1991) 357,400. Urmia is situated on a large, fertile plain to the west of Lake Urmia. Formerly known as Reza'iyeh, Urmia dates from the second millennium BC, and is one of the reputed birthplaces of Zoroaster. The city is home to Iran's longest established Christian community." See also en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Urmia "Due to Urmia's relatively large Christian population growth by the end of the 19th century, Urmia also became the seat of the first American Christian mission in Iran in 1835. " It is near where Iraq, Turkey and Iran join. 95% of the population are Kurds or Azerbaijanis
